page.title: 13Fire & Ambulance ,Liskeard
page.content: Liskeard Fire Station has 1 full- time fireman and 17 part-time firemen. There are 3 fire appliances-two large engines each carrying 400 gallons of water and a variety of equipment to deal with emergencies,and a Land Rover.All calls for the Fire Brigade are taken at the Truro Control Room and then phoned to Liskeard. It takes two or three minutes for the engine to leave the station after a call has been received. The firemen have three months training at Plymouth. There are 18 Ambulance Stations in Cornwall.Liskeard Station was built in 1968 on a site next to the Police Station and Fire Station at Luxstowe, Liskeard.There are 4 ambulances,10 men and a Commanding Officer.The station is equiped with a resuscitator and a defibulator.
